title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.en: (Cautions) Or fame or life, Which do you hold more dear?
Or life or wealth, To which would you adhere?
Keep life and lose those other things; Keep them and lose your life: - which brings Sorrow and pain more near?
Thus we may see, Who cleaves to fame Rejects what is more great;
Who loves large stores Gives up the richer state.

passages.zh: 知足不辱，知止不殆，可以長久。
passages.en: Who is content Needs fear no shame. Who knows to stop Incurs no blame. From danger free Long live shall he.
